section.name: Introduction
section.p: Object Ledge is a platform for building applications in Java 2 Standard and Enterprise Edition environments.
ObjectLedge follows component / container and Inversion Of Control design paradigms implemented with the excelent PicoContainer package.

ObjectLedge provides a number of components - basic building blocks of the applications, a few extensions to the Pico framework, customized containers for easy deployment of applications in command line, daemon, and J2EE servlet environments.

subsection.name: Why the name?
subsection.p:
"Webster's Revised Unabridged Dictionary (1913)"
Ledge Ledge (le^j), n. Akin to AS. licgan to lie, Icel.
liggja; cf. Icel. l"ogg the ledge or rim at the bottom of a
cask. See Lie to be prostrate. Formerly written lidge.

ol.li:
A shelf on which articles may be laid; also, that which
resembles such a shelf in form or use, as a projecting
ridge or part, or a molding or edge in joinery.
A shelf, ridge, or reef, of rocks.

A layer or stratum.
The lowest ledge or row should be of stone.
-- Sir H. Wotton.

(Mining) A lode; a limited mass of rock bearing valuable
mineral.

(Shipbuilding) A piece of timber to support the deck,
placed athwartship between beams.

subsection.p: We hope that Object Ledge will be a rock-solid foundation on which a variety of aplications can be built easily and quickly, with confidence into the platform's integrity.
